Thus have I heard.

They accomplished mindfulness and wisdom and were replete with shame and humility.
They had no obstructions in the Buddha's teachings.
They were unasked friends for all beings.
They closely approached and taught, accomplishing wholesome dharmas.
They came and went freely in the Buddha lands.
In accordance with the minds of beings, they taught them with wholesome dharmas.
They were free from all the realms of MÄra's activities.
They eliminated all the afflictions and enemies.
They were well able to universally enter all dharma realms.
They were able to make offerings to all Buddhas.
They were able to abide in all dhyÄna, liberation, and samÄdhi.

Such were the foremost bodhisattva mahÄsattvas, twelve thousand in all.ğŸ”½The YÄma Heaven's son and others, eighty thousand sons of heaven,
The Tuá¹£ita Heaven's son, eighty koá¹­Ä«s,
9,200 nayutas of YÄma Heaven's sons,
15,000 nayutas of Paranirmita-vaÅ›avartin Heaven's sons,
from the Paranirmita-vaÅ›avartin Heaven up to the innumerable devas of the form realm, all came to assemble.
At that time, to the east, beyond buddha-lands as numerous as the dust particles of ninety-two buddha-realms,
there was a world called Unsurpassed.
Within it was a buddha named Well-Conquered Power TathÄgata.
There was a bodhisattva mahÄsattva named Supremely Victorious.
Surrounded by a great assembly of bodhisattvas in front and behind,
in a single thought, he disappeared from that realm.
Suddenly he appeared in this SahÄ world.
He stayed in the sky.
Each bodhisattva emitted a beryl cloud,
covering the trichiliocosm.
It rained JambÅ« River gold flowers.
Each bodhisattva rained offering implements as numerous as the dust particles in a buddha-world.

Each bodhisattva rained down as many various flowers born from water and land as there are dust motes in a buddha-world.ğŸ”½Each bodhisattva rained down as many subtle various fragrances as there are dust motes in a buddha-world.
Each bodhisattva rained down as many clouds and rains of various fragrances such as sandalwood, agarwood, and black aloe as there are dust motes in a buddha-world.
Each bodhisattva rained down as many various jeweled garlands of the seven treasures as there are dust motes in a buddha-world.

Each bodhisattva rained down as many sandalwood fragrances as there are dust motes in a buddha-world.ğŸ”½Each bodhisattva rained down as many various sublime celestial and human garments as there are dust motes in a buddha-world.
Each bodhisattva rained down as many various adorned jeweled banners and pennants as there are dust motes in a buddha-world.
Each bodhisattva uttered as many praises in verses as there are dust motes in a buddha-world.
All were unprecedented praises of the TathÄgata.
At that time, in this SahÄ world,
All the sentient beings in the hells who were suffering were relieved of their pain and found peace and joy.
All sentient beings looked upon each other with loving eyes.
All hungry ghosts were completely satisfied.
All sentient beings were free from greed, anger, and delusion.
They were neither cold nor hot, had no thoughts or desires, and were neither hungry nor thirsty.
The weather was clear and warm, without any dust or fog.
At that time, all sentient beings were satisfied with their forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and tactile experiences, and became indulgent.
All the gods attained tranquility.
At that time, the Bodhisattva MahÄsattva Most Excellent went up to the Akaniá¹£á¹­ha Heaven.
He stayed in the sky and rained down various offerings.
He made offerings to the TathÄgata.
He rained down all kinds of flower garlands, mixed incense, ointments, powdered incense, clothes, canopies, banners, pennants, and various wonderful adornments.
He rained down on all the palaces of the gods, dragons, yaká¹£as, gandharvas, asuras, garuá¸as, kiá¹ƒnaras, and mahoragas.
And the palaces of the Four Heavenly Kings up to the trichiliocosm were all completely filled.
At that time, the Bodhisattva MahÄsattva JÃ±Änottama descended from above and approached the World-Honored One.
Having arrived, he bowed his head at the feet of the World-Honored One and circumambulated him innumerable times.
He covered the TathÄgata with a net of heavenly pure lapis lazuli vajra pearls.
And sat to one side.
At that time, JÃ±Änottama saw the World-Honored Buddha enter the Dharma of the one true reality.
When entering this Dharma,
He was able to enter the Dharma gates spoken by all Buddhas of the three times.
He was able to know the immeasurable corresponding eloquence of the Buddhas.
Liberated eloquence.ğŸ”½Unimpeded eloquence.ğŸ”½Unattached eloquence.
Endless eloquence.
Eloquence in all places.
Universal eloquence.
Eloquence spoken through the skillful means of the suchness of all dharmas.
Eloquence of the gates of liberation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.
Eloquence of skillfully discriminating and clearly explaining the mindfulness of all meditations, liberations, and samÄdhis as they really are.
The eloquence of speaking about the arising and cessation of right effort.
The eloquence of speaking about the going and coming of the bases of spiritual power.
The eloquence of the faculties, powers, and wisdom.
The eloquence of the power of invincibility.
The eloquence of the realization of enlightenment as it truly is.
The eloquence of discerning the dharma realm.
The eloquence of seeing as it truly is.
The eloquence of all dharmas as they truly are, like illusions, bubbles, flames, the moon in the water, echoes, and so forth.
The eloquence of non-arising and non-cessation as it truly is.
The subtle eloquence.
The various eloquence.
The melodious eloquence.
The eloquence of knowing the minds of sentient beings as they truly are, whether wholesome or unwholesome.
The eloquence of a single voice in all assemblies.
The eloquence of all dharmas.
At that time, the Venerable Victorious One saw such things.
He immediately rose from his seat, adjusted his robes,
placed his right knee on the ground, joined his palms towards the Buddha,
and said to the Buddha, World-Honored One,
please grant me a little leisure.
Allow me to ask the TathÄgata, the Perfectly Enlightened One.
At that time, the World-Honored One told the Bodhisattva Victorious One,
I always grant leisure to sentient beings.
Ask whatever you wish.
The TathÄgata's right enlightenment will cut off your doubts and please your mind.
At that time, Bodhisattva Most Excellent addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One.
There is a dhÄraá¹‡Ä« called the Dharma Door of the Immeasurable True Teachings of All Dharmas.
If there are bodhisattvas who attain this dhÄraá¹‡Ä« and the corresponding Dharma door,
those bodhisattvas will be able to attain uninterrupted eloquence,
ignorance-free eloquence,
eloquence in all dharmas, eloquence in action and non-action,
knowledge of unobstructed eloquence in dhÄraá¹‡Ä«s,
subtle eloquence,
able to uphold all the teachings of the buddhas,
able to know immeasurable teachings,
and further able to enter the wisdom of the aggregate of dhÄraá¹‡Ä«s,
able to enter the wisdom of the realms, the wisdom of the faculties,
enter the wisdom of true reality,
enter the wisdom of all sentient beings,
enter the wisdom of non-sentient beings,ğŸ”½enter the wisdom of existence,
enter the wisdom of non-existence,
enter the wisdom of attachment,
enter the wisdom of non-attachment,ğŸ”½enter the wisdom of emptiness,
enter the wisdom of non-emptiness,
enter the wisdom of conceptual thoughts,
Entering the cognition of non-conception.
Entering the cognition of having vows.
Entering the cognition of having no vows.
Entering the cognition of having reliance.
Entering the cognition of having no reliance.
Entering the cognition of the conditioned.
Entering the cognition of the unconditioned.
Entering the cognition of unobstructed eloquence in a single place.
May the World-Honored One,
Out of compassion for all, explain this dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateway.
At that time, the World-Honored One praised the Venerable Victorious One, saying:
Excellent, excellent!
Victorious One,
You are able to ask the TathÄgata and Perfectly Enlightened One about this matter.
Victorious One,
Now listen carefully and contemplate it well.
I will explain it for you.
At that time, the Venerable Victorious One accepted the teaching and listened carefully.
The Buddha told the Victorious One:

The Sutra of the Questions of the Bodhisattva Varaprabha Translator's Biography The Kaiyuan Catalog says:
During the Gao-Qi period,
there was a layman named Wan Tianyi.
His original surname was Tuoba.
He was a person from Yunzhong in the north.ğŸ”½The Wei dynasty divided into ten surnames.
He became a member of the Wan clan.
He lived in Luoyang for generations.
Therefore, he was also a person from Henan (the title India is incorrect).
Later, he was simply called the Wan clan.
Yi had once left home as a young man.
He studied under a Brahmin.
He was intelligent and had determination.
He was good at writing in Sanskrit and speaking Sanskrit.
He was also skilled in spells.
For this reason, he was summoned and allowed to participate in the translation work.
In the years of Heqing during the reign of Emperor Wu Cheng Zhan,
he translated the Sutra of the Questions of the Bodhisattva Varaprabha in one part at the capital Ye.
It was widely circulated in the world. It is the same text as the Sutra of Limitless Life.
